alert.note: Alert for Orleans (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 12:32PM EST until December 19 at 11:48AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Vermont, including the following counties, Caledonia, Essex and Orleans. * WHEN...Until 630 PM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1227 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area, including the East Branch of the Passumpic as seen on the East Haven gauge. Between 1.25 and 1.75 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lyndon, St. Johnsbury, Lyndonville Village, Kirby, West Burke Village, Wheelock, Burke, Sutton, Danville, Sheffield, Waterford, Newark Hollow, Victory, Newark, Barnet, Westmore, East Haven, Glover, Peacham and Barton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
